FILE: cm220920v11.0.txt
DYAD: FRANCE - NEW ZEALAND
RIVALRY: RIV598
DISPUTE(S): MID258 
RIVALRY: RIV599
DISPUTE(S): MID2600 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20171225
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20171225

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

WWII MIDs: MID258

MID2600 

TERRMID: MID2600 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2600 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2600 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID2600 from Gibler (2018), in 1985, France bombed and sunk a Greenpeace ship sitting in a New Zealand harbor. The Greenpeace crew was preparing to protest French nuclear testing. Coded not maritime because no maritime boundary was being disputed.

ISLMID: MID2600 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2600 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID2600 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2600 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2600 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2600 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler, D.M. 2018. Militarized Interstate Dispute Narratives, 1816-2010. Langham, MD: Rowman and Littlefield.
